column2: b'@LuisVSanchez777 @TidefallCapital @icebergdevalor 2) Agree legacy branch based LTO secularly challenged. This is why both went big into virtual LTO: $RCII bought Preferred Lease/Acima and $AAN bought $PGR. AAN smart to spin off PGR, likely endgame for RCII as well. vLTO more comparable to BNPL but secured vs unsecured lending'

b"@BlueToothDDS @icebergdevalor Isn't the recent BNPL innovations turning every company into a rent-a-center model? What do the $RCII's of the world look like in 5 years with BNPL growing this quickly? Not great I imagine."

b'@TidefallCapital Would also suggest taking a look at $PRG (recent spin off from $AAN) and $RCII (which just announced combining their Preferred Dyanmix with Acima), today the #1 and #2 in the LTO space both with $2B+ revenue (10x Katapult today).  Better valuation as well...\n\nh/t @icebergdevalor https://t.co/uIm8wscwiI'
b"RT @alsterbrown: @Patrick_Invests Completely missed this one (big run) but looks pricey at first glance no? ($4.5B EV on $100M in '20 revs)\xe2\x80\xa6"

b"@Patrick_Invests Completely missed this one (big run) but looks pricey at first glance no? ($4.5B EV on $100M in '20 revs) 

I do think the non-prime mkt is under-served (it's ~ 40% of US consumers.) 

I like this $RCII which has quietly become a leader in Virtual Lease to Own for that mkt."

b"@StocksWarlock It's an interesting story in an emerging new fintech mkt; virtual lease to own (VLTO) which is very similar to BNPL (Afterpay, Affirm) except that they deal with with people who have weak credit (which is said to be 40% of US consumers.) $RCII is another way to play VLTO - fyi."
